text:
Created attachment 31207
the diff for this patch

Currently, a style is only applied to a cell if the cell style attribute ("s") is present.  Following XSSFCell.getCellStyle(), if the attribute is not present, and there are are more than 0 styles in the styles table, we should use the default (0) style.

This patch may also be the resolution for https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=55648.
creator: shaun.kalley@shaw.ca
apache@gagravarr.org
text: Any chance you could work up a short unit test to go with the patch, which shows the problem + ensures it is solved?

Created attachment 31211
diff for test case

text: Thanks for the patch and testcase, this is now included via r1563470, it will not be contained in 3.10, though, as we already cut that version before.
